column1:
BEFORE 
DEVIKA  DE L.  TENNEKOON, J  &

COUNSEL 
Neranjan Jayasinghe for the Accused-Appellant.
Shanaka Wijesinghe  D.S.G.  for the Respondent.

Accused-appellant 
lS  present  m  Court  produced  by 
the
Counsel for  the accused-appellant has obtained instructions

from 
the  accused-appellant 
to  withdraw 
the  application  and  makes

submissions  pointing  certain 
shortcomings  in  the  judgment  and  the

conviction.  The 
accused-appellant  present  in  Court  when  inquired 
in
Sinhala confirms that he wants to withdraw the appeal and he wants the
Counsel to make submissions.  Counsel submits that;
(1)  there are several shortcomings in this case including the date of
offence. The date of offence is not certain in the judgment.
